member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY
member.summary: Represents the different process mitigation policies.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessDEPPolicy
member.summary: The data execution prevention (DEP) policy of the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessASLRPolicy
member.summary: The Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) policy of the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessDynamicCodePolicy
member.summary: The policy that turns off the ability of the process to generate dynamic code or modify existing executable code.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessStrictHandleCheckPolicy
member.summary: The process will receive a fatal error if it manipulates an invalid handle. Useful for preventing downstream problems in a process due to handle misuse.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessSystemCallDisablePolicy
member.summary: Disables the ability to use NTUser/GDI functions at the lowest layer.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessMitigationOptionsMask
member.summary: Returns the mask of valid bits for all the mitigation options on the system. An application can set many mitigation options without querying the operating system for mitigation options by combining bitwise with the mask to exclude all non-supported bits at once.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessExtensionPointDisablePolicy
member.summary: The policy that prevents some built-in third party extension points from being turned on, which prevents legacy extension point DLLs from being loaded into the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessControlFlowGuardPolicy
member.summary: The Control Flow Guard (CFG) policy of the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessSignaturePolicy
member.summary: The policy of a process that can restrict image loading to those images that are either signed by Microsoft, by the Windows Store, or by Microsoft, the Windows Store and the Windows Hardware Quality Labs (WHQL).

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessFontDisablePolicy
member.summary: The policy that turns off the ability of the process to load non-system fonts.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessImageLoadPolicy
member.summary: The policy that turns off the ability of the process to load images from some locations, such a remote devices or files that have the low mandatory label.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessSystemCallFilterPolicy
member.summary: The system call filter policy of the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessPayloadRestrictionPolicy
member.summary: The payload restriction policy of the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessChildProcessPolicy
member.summary: The child process policy of the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessSideChannelIsolationPolicy
member.summary: The side channel isolation policy of the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessUserShadowStackPolicy
member.summary: Windows 10, version 2004 and above: The policy regarding user-mode Hardware-enforced Stack Protection for the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessRedirectionTrustPolicy
member.summary: The RedirectionGuard policy of the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessUserPointerAuthPolicy
member.summary: The user pointer authentication policy of the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.ProcessSEHOPPolicy
member.summary: The Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) policy of the process.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_POLICY.MaxProcessMitigationPolicy
member.summary: Ends the enumeration.
